## Pool.fetchTemporalFramebuffer() method

Creates a temporal framebuffer from the object pool.

**Signature:**

```typescript
fetchTemporalFramebuffer<T extends BaseTexture<unknown>>(autoRelease: boolean, width: number, height: number, colorTexOrFormat: MaybeArray<TextureFormat | T>, depthTexOrFormat?: TextureFormat | T, mipmapping?: boolean, sampleCount?: number, ignoreDepthStencil?: boolean, attachmentMipLevel?: number, attachmentCubeface?: number, attachmentLayer?: number): FrameBuffer;
```

boolean


</td><td>

boolean

sampleCount


</td><td>

number


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ The sample count for the framebuffer, default is 1.


</td></tr>

ignoreDepthStencil


</td><td>

boolean


</td><td>

</td></tr>
<tr><td>

attachmentMipLevel


</td><td>

number


</td><td>

</td></tr>

attachmentCubeface


</td><td>

number


</td><td>

</td></tr>
<tr><td>

</td><td>

number


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ The texture layer to which the color attachment will render, default is 0
